alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northern Gila County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:55PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila, Apache and Navajo Counties through 330 PM MST... At 255 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near North Fork, or 19 miles south of Show Low, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springerville, Eagar, North Fork, Lyman Lake State Park, Whiteriver, Fort Apache Reservation, Los Burros Campground, Mcnary, Lyman Lake, and Becker Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 373 between mile markers 386 and 387. State Route 273 between mile markers 378 and 380. State Route 260 between mile markers 358 and 393. State Route 473 between mile markers 0 and 10. State Route 73 between mile markers 344 and 357. Highway 180 191 between mile markers 380 and 394. Highway 60 between mile markers 368 and 388. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northern Gila County; White Mountains
